items.content_html:
Paper Title:

Liquid Types

Paper Year:

PLDI '08

Reasons for including paper

I presented this at PWL NYC earlier this year and realised maybe I should add it to the PL theory section.

I don't know if there is strong consensus on where in the README it should be included, but maybe there aren't enough papers in that folder for it to really matter. Can adjust as you all see fit.
items.title: [languages-theory] add liquid types

items.content_html:
Paper Title:

Temporal Alignment

Paper Year:

2012

Reasons for including paper

  • Defining a temporal version for each operator of Codd's relational algebra is a big improvement on existing temporal data techniques. It puts temporal data on a solid mathematical foundation by integrating it into relational theory. It solves the composability problems found in TSQL2 and SQL:2011.
  • The authors demonstrated the practicality of their approach by patching PostgreSQL and benchmarking their new functionality vs a pure-SQL alternative.
items.title: Add Temporal Alignment paper

items.content_html:
Paper Title: Generating 3D Models for Prototyping of Virtual Environments using NeRF

Paper Year: 2024

Reasons for including paper

  • Includes a novel approach using NeRF for generation of 3D models.
  • A faster an better way which is quantized in the results.
items.title: Add NeRF research paper

items.content_html:
Paper Title:

Zanzibar: Google’s Consistent, Global Authorization System

Paper Year:

2019

Reasons for including paper

  • A new method for access control that is a superset of RBAC and can support ABAC.
  • Main use case is social networks (Twitter, Facebook, etc)
  • Lots of open source and commercial solutions are building off this paper
items.title: add zanzibar paper for authorization

items.content_html:
Blue Screen Matting:

~1997:

Paper from the legendary James Blinn about matting algorithm

Bayesian Approach to Digital Matting:

~2001:

This paper proposes a new Bayesian framework for solving the matting problem.

Learning-based Sampling for Natural Image Matting:

~2019:

The goal of natural image matting is the estimation of opacities of a user-defined foreground object that is essential in creating realistic composite imagery. Recent paper about this topic and modern approach
items.title: Added Matting and three paper for this topic

Color Constancy and Non-Uniform Illumination: Can Existing Algorithms Work?

2011:

Interesting approach to tackle non uniform global illumination in computer vision

3D Thermal Imaging: Fusion of Thermography and Depth Cameras:

2014:

photogrammetry topic was missing and this is a very interesting paper for research.

Realtime depth map estimation from infrared stereo images of RGB-D cameras:

2021:

this is a very interesting topic for the industry, robotics and so on, as alternative to LIDAR
items.title: Added photogrammetry topic and two related paper + Color Constancy research article

items.title: Add link for Portland, OR chapter of Papers We Love

items.content_html:
We care deeply about privacy. To strengthen our knowledge in this field and understand how it relates to visual data, we do constant research in the latest scientific works about this topic. We want to share with you a curated list of machine/deep learning papers that address the topic of privacy in visual data. Although we know that it is very specific field, we think it is important to raise awareness about it.

I organised link according to this discussion #610
items.title: Add Privacy Papers for Visual Data

items.content_html:
Paper Title: On-the-Fly Garbage Collection: An Exercise in Cooperation

Paper Year: 1978

Reasons for including paper

As indicated in this blogpost:

This is the paper that introduced concurrent Garbage Collection via the tri-color marking invariant. It forms the basis for most non-concurrent incremental collectors as well. No matter where you stand on garbage collection, I think it’s useful (and interesting!) to know how collectors work, and this is one paper you’ll be hard-pressed to avoid when delving into the matter; despite the claim in the paper’s introduction that “it has hardly been our purpose to contribute specifically to the art of garbage collection, and consequently no practical significance is claimed for our solution”, this is definitely one of the most important and influential papers on GC ever written.
items.title: Add On-the-Fly Garbage Collection Paper

items.title: add kingsbury and alvaro "elle" paper

items.content_html:
Paper Title

Test-driven development with mutation testing – an experimental study

Paper Year

2020

Reasons for including paper

It presents an old idea of mutation testing in a new light of extending traditional test-driven development with it. It includes results of an experiment which was conducted to check whether TDD+M is better in terms of test efficiency than traditional TDD.
items.title: Add TDD with mutation testing (Roman & Mnich 2020)
